page.title: 02Parish Church of St.Andrew
page.content: Dating from Norman times,the building has three doors-North,South and West, the aisles from each leading to the Chancel,Lady and Strachey Chapels;the Strachey family being commemorated in the latter. A recumbent wooden effigy of Sir John de Hauteville is found in the West wall of the nave. A choir of about 15 leads the congregation at service, robing for which is effected in the vestry.From here a spiral staircase leads to the perpendicular style,100ft. high tower, passing the bell ropes and bell chamber as it ascends.A second flight leads to the organ loft. Stone gargoyles guard the church and overlook the churchyard below where the victim of a highwayman lies buried.
